author: Ava Thompson
short: Neil captured the emotion of our day beautifully—every look and laugh.
full: Neil captured the emotion of our day beautifully—every look and laugh. The timeline guidance and gentle direction made portraits easy, and the candid shots felt authentic. Turnaround time was faster than expected.

author: Jordan Smith
short: Our product photos finally match our brand—clean, consistent, and sharp.
full: Our product photos finally match our brand—clean, consistent, and sharp. Neil also delivered a color profile reference so our web team could keep tones consistent. Sales pages look far more professional now.

author: Lt. C. Reynolds
short: Professional, on time, and mission-focused. Great eye for framing in tight spaces.
full: Professional, on time, and mission-focused. Great eye for framing in tight spaces. He coordinated safely around our operations tempo and still delivered strong footage for our internal comms.

author: Maria Diaz
short: We booked Neil for highlight reels—clients loved the quick, upbeat edits.
full: We booked Neil for highlight reels—clients loved the quick, upbeat edits. He worked well with our staff, captured sponsor displays clearly, and hit every deliverable on time.

author: Chris Lee
short: Great audio handling and color—my live session looks and sounds legit.
full: Great audio handling and color—my live session looks and sounds legit. Multiple angles with clean cuts, and the sound mix matched my reference. Posting it boosted bookings.

author: Patrice Howard
short: The storytelling in our donor video was thoughtful and respectful.
full: The storytelling in our donor video was thoughtful and respectful. Neil worked around sensitive schedules and produced a concise piece that resonated at our fundraiser.

author: Ethan Walker
short: Listing photos and a 60s vertical walkthrough—fast turnaround, great polish.
full: Listing photos and a 60s vertical walkthrough—fast turnaround, great polish. The video looked great on social and helped us book several showings the first weekend.

author: Taylor Nguyen
short: Food photography that finally does our menu justice.
full: Food photography that finally does our menu justice. We got consistent lighting, true-to-life colors, and tight detail shots that make the dishes pop online.

author: Dana Brooks
short: We used Neil for team headshots—simple on-site setup and matching looks.
full: We used Neil for team headshots—simple on-site setup and matching looks. The consistent background and lighting made our careers page look cohesive.

author: Marcus Allen
short: Action photos looked crisp without weird motion blur.
full: Action photos looked crisp without weird motion blur. He anticipated plays and got strong angles—parents were thrilled with the gallery.

author: Riley Chen
short: B-roll library + product close-ups gave us plenty to work with.
full: B-roll library + product close-ups gave us plenty to work with. Editing notes were followed exactly. We’re planning a quarterly content package.

author: Sam Patel
short: We needed an investor video—tight script and clear visuals.
full: We needed an investor video—tight script and clear visuals. Neil helped refine the storyboard, and the final cut made our pitch feel far more polished.
